intro: Chorizanthe orcuttiana, commonly known as Orcutt's choris, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Chorizanthe orcuttiana is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to thrive in regions with low precipitation.
